title: PointSea: Point Cloud Completion via Self-structure Augmentation
author: Zhe Zhu (Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics), Honghua Chen (Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics), Xing He (Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics), Mingqiang Wei (Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics), ...
relevance_why: The innovative method of point cloud completion via self-structure augmentation could be applied to audio processing tasks where point clouds represent sound features, enhancing audio-visual integration strategies.
background: Point cloud completion aims to fill in missing parts of 3D data captured from real-world environments, addressing issues caused by occlusion and scanning limitations.
contribution: PointSea introduces a self-structure augmentation approach to improve point cloud completion, effectively recovering global shapes and local details from incomplete inputs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods predominantly use fixed strategies for all points, which limits their ability to articulate details for varying structural types.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work features a dual-path refinement strategy that conditions the completion based on the structural type of each point, thereby enhancing detail recovery.

key_innovation: The method uniquely integrates features from multiple self-projected views, utilizing a fusion module to enhance the understanding of global shapes before refining details at a local level.
real_world_impact: This method can improve applications in fields such as robotics and autonomous driving, where 3D perception is crucial, potentially leading to better navigation and interaction with environments.

new_terms.self-structure augmentation: **Self-structure augmentation** refers to a data representation technique where additional perspectives from a dataset are leveraged to enhance the understanding of incomplete structures in a 3D context.
